TopicTitle: Ask the Mods questions about the Forums!

Articles.Content: Is it true that after you get a 1000 rep that your rep just explodes from there? I've gotten 160 rep from November to now, something that took me way longer when I started here.

> 
> 
> 11 minutes ago, HoloYolo said:
> 
> 
> Is it true that after you get a 1000 rep that your rep just explodes from there? I've gotten 160 rep from November to now, something that took me way longer when I started here.
> 

It depends: do you get any better after you reach 1000 rep?

> 
> 
> Just now, Gaarst said:
> 
> 
> It depends: do you get any better after you reach 1000 rep?
> 

Maybe an ego boost, I'm not sure though.

> 
> 
> 16 minutes ago, HoloYolo said:
> 
> 
> Is it true that after you get a 1000 rep that your rep just explodes from there? I've gotten 160 rep from November to now, something that took me way longer when I started here.
> 

I don't think it has to do with any set rep number, just that you've been subtly conditioned by the rep system to make posts that people like.

> 
> 
> 2 hours ago, HoloYolo said:
> 
> 
> Is it true that after you get a 1000 rep that your rep just explodes from there? I've gotten 160 rep from November to now, something that took me way longer when I started here.
> 

Yes. I only rep posts by users with over 1000 points.

![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif ":P")

> 
> 
> 2 hours ago, Red Iron Crown said:
> 
> 
> I don't think it has to do with any set rep number, just that you've been subtly conditioned by the rep system to make posts that people like.
> 

I wouldn't call it "subtle." There's bells, visual cues, and "User Liked this" when someone reps your post. It's a variable ratio schedule, just like gambling. And just like gambling, when you know the system, it makes it easier to get rewards.

> 
>

> I wouldn't call it "subtle." There's bells, visual cues, and "User Liked this" when someone reps your post. It's a variable ratio schedule, just like gambling. And just like gambling, when you know the system, it makes it easier to get rewards.
> 

Does the house always win, then?

Yeah, because it keeps people coming back here. The house winning isn't always a a bad thing.

> On 12/19/2016 at 4:44 PM, Garrett Kerman said:
> 
> 
> 3. What are your favorite threads?
> 

I actually don't have any favorite threads-- can't.  That's because to have a particular favorite thread, it needs to be a long-lived (i.e. long) one, and my favorite threads are *<u>short</u>* ones that have just started.  Interesting ones pop up all the time, and when the post count is low (under 20), it's when I find things most interesting.

When the thread expands into many pages... that's when I find it less interesting, I just figure that "most of what one can say has been said", it's hard to hold the whole conversation in my head, so I tend to just cruise right on by.

...Well, except for this one.  ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")  I always find this thread interesting.

[@Red Iron Crown](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/12858-red-iron-crown/), the first rule of MQDB is, you do not talk about MQDB. ![:mad:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_angry.gif ":mad:")

I apparently have work on the brain.

I read that as MSQLDB and went "of course the forum runs on Microsoft SQL Server Database, why's that a moderator secret?"

After a second look I realized it was MQDB instead and now I'm wondering....

Moderators Quietly Drinking Beer? ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif ":cool:")

D.

> 38 minutes ago, Vanamonde said:
> 
> 
> ![:mad:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_angry.gif ":mad:")
> 

This is where it gets fun, right [@monstah](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/95210-monstah/)?

What's the hierarchy in the forums? I imagine something like:

1-SQUAD  

2-SQUAD Staff  

3-Global moderator  

4-Moderator  

5-Users

Is it right? And if so, who is SQUAD? I mean, somebody is behind it.  

What 'power' and responsibilities each one have?

Thanks!

The Squad account isn't a person, it's a communal account sometimes used for announcements and such. It doesn't have any real power.

Squad staff varies, too. There are a variety of positions and a hierarchy of its own there.

Global mods are nominally above regular mods in the hierarchy, but in practice this matters little. We try to moderate by consensus, and the newest mods' voices are just as important as the veterans for that.
